page.title: 08ECOLOGY.DOWNLAND,EDINGTON
page.content: The bottom third of the 12 sq.km.block forms part of the Imber Ranges,an army live firing area.It is all uncultivated except for M.o.D. tree planting,programmes which are in operation every year,the Wiltshire County Council always being informed beforehand.The ranges as a whole cover 25000 acres and form one of the largest areas of uncultivated chalkland in England,possibly in Europe, and as such house a wide variety of flora and fauna. Surveys, organised by the MOD,are made at frequent intervals by voluntary teams headed by experts in wild life, recording their findings at the MOD and also at the relevant National Biological Research Centre. This is a combined effort between authorised civilians and the army.
